p: The native honey bee, Apis cerana, was the primary pollinator of pumpkin flowers (92% of the total sample). In 8% of the flowers, another native bee species, Apis dorsata, also visited the flowers along with A. cerana. Since A. dorsata was a minority, we used pooled data of visitation characteristics of both the species in the analyses after realizing that the response of both the species of bees was the same towards the ants.
